full_text:
In the Court of the Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate,
Thiruvananthapuram
Present: Elsa Catherine George
Additional Chief Judicial Magistrate.
Thursday the 6" day of March 2025
CC : 865/2024

Complainant : State represented by the Sub Inspector of Police,
Poojappura Police Station in Crime No. 856/2024
(By A.P.P )

Accused : Sajeevan @ Vakkeel Sajeevan, 67 years, S/o Krishna
Pillai, Sreekrishna Vilasom Veedu, Kamalalaya Lane,
Near NSS High School, Thottakkara, Ottappalam,
Palakkad District.
(By Adv. Smt. Shincy B â€” Legal Aid Defence
Counsel)

Charge : Offence punishable u/s 305, 331(3), 334(1) and 238
of Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita

Plea : Guilty

Finding : Guilty

Sentence/order Accused is found guilty of the offences u/s 305,
331(3), 334(1) and 238 of Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita
and is convicted thereunder. Accused is sentenced to
undergo Rigorous Imprisonment for a period of 3
years and to pay fine of %50,000/- for the offence
punishable u/s 305 of BNS. In default of payment of
fine, he shall undergo Rigorous Imprisonment for a
period of 6 months. Accused is further sentenced to
undergo Rigorous Imprisonment for a period of 3
years and to pay fine of ~ 25,000/- for the offence u/s
331(3) of BNS. In default of payment of fine, he
shall undergo Rigorous Imprisonment for a period of
4 months. Accused is further sentenced to undergo
Rigorous Imprisonment for a period of 1 year and to
pay a fine of Rs.10,000/- for the offence u/s 334(1)
of BNS. In default of payment of fine, he shall

2

undergo Rigorous Imprisonment for a period of 3
months. Accused is further sentenced to undergo
Rigorous Imprisonment for a period of 1 year
and to pay a fine of Rs.10,000/- for the offence
wWs 238 of BNS. In default of payment of fine,
he shall undergo Rigorous Imprisonment for a
period of 3 months. Sentences shall run
concurrently. Set off is allowed from 07/08/2024
till 06/03/2025. Fine amount if realized, shall be
paid as compensation to CW1 u/s 395(1) of
BNSS.

This case having been finally heard on today the court on the same day delivered

the following :-
JUDGMENT

1. This is a case charge sheeted by the Sub Inspector of Police, Poojappura
Police Station crime No. 856/2024 against the accused alleging commission
of offences w/s 305, 331(3), 334(1), 238 and 13 of Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

2. The case of the prosecution as revealed from the final report is that on
19/07/2024 at 12.05 pm, the accused who has criminal antecedents trespassed
into the house of CW1 bearing No. 17/200, Melarannoor Government
Quarters in Thycaud Village, broke open the door of the house using iron rod
and committed theft of 8.5 sovereigns of gold ornaments worth Rs.4,00,000.
Thereafter the accused destroyed evidence in such a manner so as to render
recovery of stolen gold ornaments impossible. The accused thereby
committed the offences as alleged against him. It is also reported that the
accused has been convicted in 2013 in a case CC: 3232/2013 (Poojappura
Police Station) and also in 2018 in CC: 476/2018 (Kazhakuttom Police

3

Station), CC 785/2018 (Kottayam Gandhi Nagar Police Station and also in

CC: 297/2019 and CC: 1211/2017 (Both of Emakulam Central Police

Station).

3. Accused is under custody from 07/08/2024. Accused is produced. He is
represented by legal aid defence counsel. He filed petition to plead guilty.
Hence, charge for the offences u/s 305, 331(3), 334(1) and 238 of Bharatiya
Nyaya Sanhita was framed, read over and explained to the accused to which
he pleaded guilty. The plea is voluntarily made, with proper legal assistance
and after fully understanding the consequences thereof. The accused is
therefore found guilty of the offences u/s 305, 331(3), 334(1) and 238 of
Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and is convicted thereunder. Even though, section 13
of BNS is arrayed, the certified copies of relevant judgments are not seen
produced along with the final report. Hence, charge for enhanced punishment
u/s 31 of BNSS is not framed against the accused.

4. Heard the accused on question of sentence u/s 271(2) of BNSS. Accused
submitted that he has nothing to state regarding the sentence. Accordingly the
accused is sentenced as follows:

1. Accused is sentenced to undergo Rigorous Imprisonment for a period of 3
years and to pay fine of %50,000/- for the offence punishable u/s 305 of
BNS. In default of payment of fine, he shall undergo Rigorous
Imprisonment for a period of 6 months.

2. Accused is further sentenced to undergo Rigorous Imprisonment for a
period of 3 years and to pay fine of % 25,000/- for the offence u/s 331(3)
of BNS. In default of payment of fine, he shall undergo Rigorous

4
Imprisonment for a period of 4 months.
3. Accused is further sentenced to undergo Rigorous Imprisonment for a
period of 1 year and to pay a fine of Rs.10,000/- for the offence u/s 334(1)
of BNS. In default of payment of fine, he shall undergo Rigorous
Imprisonment for a period of 3 months.
4. Accused is further sentenced to undergo Rigorous Imprisonment for a
period of 1 year and to pay a fine of Rs.10,000/- for the offence u/s 238
of BNS. In default of payment of fine, he shall undergo Rigorous
Imprisonment for a period of 3 months.
5. Sentences shall run concurrently. Set off is allowed from 07/08/2024 till
06/03/2025. Fine amount if realized, shall be paid as compensation to
CW1 w/s 395(1) of BNSS.
Properties produced in this case as T 270/2024, item No.1 lock being
valueless, shall be destroyed. Item No. 2 smart phone shall be confiscated.
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected
and pronounced by me in open Court on this the 6" day of March 2025.
Sy.
. SION on Sl
Elsa Catherine George,
